Eternal Hunger.name: Eternal Hunger
Eternal Hunger.blurb: Warwick's basic attacks deal bonus magic damage. If Warwick is below 50% health, he heals the same amount. If Warwick is below 25% health, this healing triples.
Eternal Hunger.description: Innate: Warwick's basic attacks deal 10 − 44 (based on level)  bonus magic damage on-hit.
Eternal Hunger.description2: While  below 50% maximum health he is also  healed by the amount of post-mitigation damage Eternal Hunger deals. This healing is increased  by 150%    to 25 − 110 (based on level)  while  below 25% maximum health.
Eternal Hunger.notes:
* The enhanced attack will apply other on-hit effects and can  critically strike as normal (the bonus damage cannot).
 Eternal Hunger does not affect structures.

Jaws of the Beast.name: Jaws of the Beast
Jaws of the Beast.blurb: Warwick lunges forward and bites his target, dealing damage based on their maximum health and healing for damage dealt.
Jaws of the Beast.description: Active: Warwick  dashes  unstoppably to the target enemy and bites them, dealing magic damage, applying on-hit effects and  healing himself for a portion of the post-mitigation damage dealt. The on-hits apply after the healing is calculated.
Jaws of the Beast.leveling:
Magic Damage:120% AD (+ 100% AP) (+ 6 / 7 / 8 / 9 / 10% of target's maximum health)
Healing Percentage:30 / 45 / 60 / 75 / 90%
Jaws of the Beast.description2: If Jaws of the Beast is held, Warwick will lock his teeth into his target and use them to swing himself around to their far side. Warwick is  unable to act while swinging around his target, and will move wherever they move until he jumps off. Warwick is unstoppable while attached to an enemy.
Jaws of the Beast.notes:
* The ability will not cancel if the target dies during its cast time.
 Warwick cannot be  displaced while attached to an enemy, but can be  knocked down prior to reaching them.
 The button must be held until Warwick reaches his target to trigger the second effect. 
 While Jaws of the Beast does not use Quick Casting by default, click-and-hold is comparable to the input required to use  Piercing Arrow or  Decimating Smash while using Quick Casting. It does not accept two-click input (e.g. First Cast and Second Cast) that Standard Casters will be used to on the aforementioned abilities.
 The distance traveled past the target depends on how long the ability was held after Warwick reached the target.

Blood Hunt.name: Blood Hunt
Blood Hunt.blurb: Warwick senses enemies below 50% health, gaining movement speed toward and attack speed against them. When they fall below 20% health, he frenzies and these bonuses triple.
Blood Hunt.description: Passive: Warwick senses all enemy  champions below  below 50% of their maximum health, marking them as Blood Hunted as well as highlighting their position to his team. Warwick additionally sees a "blood trail" highlighting the shortest path to the Blood Hunted target, and gains  bonus movement speed while following it.
Blood Hunt.description2: Warwick also gains  bonus attack speed upon attacking a Blood Hunted target or an enemy unit  below 50% of their maximum health.
Blood Hunt.description3: The bonus movement and attack speed is increased by 150% against enemies  below 20% maximum health.
Blood Hunt.description4: Active: Warwick briefly senses all enemies and then Blood Hunts the nearest enemy champion within a large radius for 8 seconds, regardless of their  current health.
Blood Hunt.description5: After being in combat with a champion, Blood Hunt may only be activated passively for 3 seconds. Its bonus movement speed will also be lost for 0.5 seconds, but will build up again every 0.25 seconds over the next 3.5 seconds.
Blood Hunt.notes:
* Enemies who are Blood Hunted will display a red wolf mark on their heads while ominous music will replace their Summoner's Rift default chosen song until they are no longer Blood Hunted, with a small delay.
 Blood Hunt can detect and target decoys.
 The blood trail, altough described as a trail, does not indicate where the target has been - only the quickest route to their current location, and it will update as you and/or the target move.
 Warwick will lose his movement speed bonus if enemies that are not Blood Hunted stay exactly between him and the Blood Hunted target.
 Blood Hunt's passive only senses enemies that go below the health threshold while Warwick is alive. A unit that went below 50% health while Warwick was dead and has not taken damage while he is alive will not be detected by Blood Hunt until it falls low again.
 Same applies to enemy champions that went under the threshold by taking Nexus Obelisk damage or to units that spawn with their current health below the threshold (i.e  Hallucinate,  Mirror Image).

 The detection from Blood Hunt is more similar to  Tremor Sense than a form of sight - it grants positional information only. It does not explicitly inform Warwick about who is low health or if they are alone.

Primal Howl.name: Primal Howl
Primal Howl.blurb: Warwick gains damage reduction for 2.5 seconds. At the end, or if re-activated, he howls, causing nearby enemies to flee for 1 second.
Primal Howl.description: First Cast: Warwick reduces all incoming damage received for 2.5 seconds. After 1 second, Primal Howl can be re-activated, and automatically does so after 2.5 seconds.
Primal Howl.description2: Second Cast: Warwick unleashes a howl, ending the damage reduction in the process, and causes all nearby enemies to  flee for 1 second as well as  slowing them by 90%.
Primal Howl.description3: Landing  Infinite Duress will instantly reactivate Primal Howl without prematurely ending the damage reduction buff.
Primal Howl.notes:
* The second activation will cancel Warwick's basic attack.
 Warwick cannot attack during the animation.

Infinite Duress.name: Infinite Duress
Infinite Duress.blurb: Warwick leaps in a direction (scaling with his bonus movement speed), suppressing the first champion he collides with for 1.5 seconds.
Infinite Duress.description: Active: Warwick  leaps  unstoppably in the target direction,  suppressing the first champion he collides with for 1.5 seconds.
Infinite Duress.description2: Warwick  channels while the target is  suppressed, dealing magic damage by hitting the target up to 6 times while also applying on-hit effects up to 3 times. Infinite Duress  heals Warwick for all the damage dealt.
Infinite Duress.notes:
* There is a brief delay before the leap and the target suppression can begin.
 The dash will be  interrupted instantly if an enemy  blinks in front of Warwick.
 The minimum range of the ability is 275 units, based on the minimum movement speed that a champion can have (110) while still being able to move. The "base" range of this ability is 837.5 because of his 335 base movement speed.
 Considering movement speed soft caps, with  Blood Hunt, this range increases to 1112 / 1145.5 / 1179 / 1203.125 / 1224.0625, further increased to 1360.15625 / 1412.5 / 1464.84375 / 1517.1875 / 1569.53125 against enemy champions below 20% health.

 The 6 hits are done in cycles of 2 hits every 0.5 seconds. The first hit deals 2/9 of the total damage and triggers the on-hit effects once while the second hit deals 1/9 of it.
 The healing is increased by  life steal.
 If Warwick does not collide with a champion, he will slide a fixed distance past the maximum range during which he is  disarmed and unable to cast movement abilities, including  Flash, but being able to cast  Jaws of the Beast and  Blood Hunt, with the former also interrupting the slide.
 Warwick is able to cast  Primal Howl at any time during the leap.
